intro: Adesmia torcaea, commonly known as the yellow burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by pod-like fruits containing seeds. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets, and it thrives in dry, arid environments. Adesmia torcaea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
